Class OrderService

java.lang.Object
edu.tamu.csce331.sharetea.database.OrderService
public class OrderService extends Object
Service class for managing order-related database operations in the Sharetea POS system.

This service provides comprehensive functionality for handling orders, order items, payments, and sales analytics. It manages the complete order lifecycle from creation to completion, including payment processing and reporting capabilities.

Key features include:

  • Order creation and management
  • Order item processing with customization support
  • Payment recording and tracking
  • Sales analytics and reporting
  • Date-range based order retrieval
  • Top-selling item analysis

The service handles multiple database tables:

  • orders - Main order records
  • order_items - Individual items within orders
  • payments - Payment transaction records
  • menu_items - Referenced for item details
  • users - Referenced for order creator information

This service also provides inner classes for data transfer objects:

  • OrderService.SalesSummary - Daily sales statistics
  • OrderService.TopSellingItem - Top-selling item analytics
Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderService

      public OrderService()

  • Method Details

    • createOrder

      public Order createOrder(Order order)
      Creates a new order in the database and returns it with the generated ID.

      This method inserts a new order record into the database and retrieves the auto-generated order ID. The method handles all order fields including customer information, pricing details, payment method, and order notes.

      The order will be created with the current timestamp and the provided status. The method uses prepared statements with generated keys to ensure proper ID retrieval.

      This method is typically called as the first step in the order creation process, followed by adding order items using addOrderItems(Long, List).

      Parameters:
      order - the Order object containing all order details to be created. Must not be null and should have valid pricing and customer information.
      Returns:
      the created Order object with the generated order ID, or null if the creation failed
      See Also:
      • for adding items to the created order
      • for recording payment information

    • addOrderItems

      public boolean addOrderItems(Long orderId, List<OrderItem> orderItems)
      Adds multiple order items to an existing order using batch processing.

      This method efficiently adds multiple order items to a specific order using batch processing for optimal database performance. Each order item includes menu item details, quantities, pricing, customization options, and preparation tracking.

      The method handles JSON serialization of customization options and automatically converts empty or null options to an empty JSON object. It also supports optional preparation tracking with user and timestamp information.

      This method should be called after creating an order using createOrder(Order) to populate the order with items.

      Parameters:
      orderId - the unique identifier of the order to add items to
      orderItems - a List of OrderItem objects containing the items to be added. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      true if all order items were successfully added, false if any items failed to be added
      See Also:
      • for creating the order first
      • for retrieving order items

    • createPayment

      public boolean createPayment(Payment payment)
      Creates a payment record for an order.

      This method records payment information for a completed order, including the payment amount, method, transaction reference, and timestamp. This is essential for financial tracking and reconciliation.

      The method supports various payment methods and can handle transaction references for external payment processors. The payment timestamp is automatically set to the current time.

      This method should be called after order creation and item addition to complete the order processing workflow.

      Parameters:
      payment - the Payment object containing payment details to be recorded. Must not be null and should have valid order ID and amount.
      Returns:
      true if the payment was successfully recorded, false if the operation failed
      See Also:
      • for creating the order
      • for adding items to the order

    • getOrdersByDateRange

      public List<Order> getOrdersByDateRange(LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime endDate)
      Retrieves orders within a specified date range with creator information.

      This method performs a complex query that joins orders with user information to provide comprehensive order details including the name of the user who created each order. Orders are returned in descending chronological order (most recent first).

      The method is useful for:

      • Generating daily, weekly, or monthly sales reports
      • Analyzing order patterns and trends
      • Auditing order history
      • Staff performance tracking
      Parameters:
      startDate - the beginning of the date range (inclusive)
      endDate - the end of the date range (inclusive)
      Returns:
      a List of Order objects within the specified date range, ordered by order time descending. Returns an empty list if no orders exist in the range or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving items within specific orders
      • for sales statistics

    • getOrderItems

      public List<OrderItem> getOrderItems(Long orderId)
      Retrieves all order items for a specific order with menu item details.

      This method performs a join between order_items and menu_items tables to provide comprehensive item information including the menu item name. Items are returned in chronological order of creation.

      The returned OrderItem objects include:

      • Item details (quantity, pricing, subtotal)
      • Customization options (as JSON)
      • Preparation tracking information
      • Menu item name for display purposes
      Parameters:
      orderId - the unique identifier of the order to retrieve items for
      Returns:
      a List of OrderItem objects containing all items in the specified order, ordered by creation time. Returns an empty list if the order has no items or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving orders
      • for adding items to orders

    • getDailySalesSummary

      public OrderService.SalesSummary getDailySalesSummary(LocalDateTime date)
      Generates a comprehensive sales summary for a specific date.

      This method calculates key sales metrics for a given date, including total number of orders, total sales revenue, and average order value. The analysis excludes voided orders to provide accurate business metrics.

      The returned SalesSummary object contains:

      • Total number of completed orders
      • Total sales revenue (sum of all order totals)
      • Average order value (total sales divided by order count)

      This method is useful for:

      • Daily sales reporting
      • Performance tracking
      • Business analytics
      • Dashboard displays
      Parameters:
      date - the date to generate the sales summary for
      Returns:
      a SalesSummary object containing the calculated metrics for the specified date. Returns zero values if no orders exist for the date or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for the returned data structure
      • for item-level analytics

    • getTopSellingItems

      public List<OrderService.TopSellingItem> getTopSellingItems(LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime endDate)
      Analyzes top-selling menu items within a specified date range.

      This method performs comprehensive analytics on menu item sales, calculating total quantities sold, revenue generated, and order frequency for each item. Results are ranked by total quantity sold and limited to the top 10 performers.

      The analysis excludes voided orders and provides insights into:

      • Most popular menu items by quantity
      • Highest revenue-generating items
      • Order frequency patterns
      • Sales performance trends

      This method is useful for:

      • Menu optimization decisions
      • Inventory planning
      • Marketing strategy development
      • Performance reporting
      Parameters:
      startDate - the beginning of the analysis period (inclusive)
      endDate - the end of the analysis period (inclusive)
      Returns:
      a List of TopSellingItem objects containing the top 10 selling items ranked by quantity sold. Returns an empty list if no sales exist in the period or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for the returned data structure
      • for overall sales metrics
